captions.text: Whew! Ha ha ha!
That's more like it that's how we do it in North Georgia, folks.

Perhaps the best way to understand the
Camaro Z28

is to think of it as a homologation
special for a racing series that doesn't
exist.

How else could you explain the massive
splitter,

huge wheels and brakes, and high revving
7-liter V8?

Underneath we have the hand assembled
7-liter
dry sump 427 V8.
This thing is a monster. 505 horsepower at 6100 rpm.
A red line at 7000 rpm it is

a wonderful, wonderful engine. K&N cold
air induction system

as I mentioned the dry sump oiling system
and really beefy 6-speed manual.

This thing has all the hard work to make
it a monster on the track.

We tried testing the Z28 in Alabama but
the weather wasn't cooperating.

With near-freezing temperatures the
surface wouldn't provide enough grip

going for braking and handling data was
pointless.
A month later, Chevy brought the Z28 to California so we could test it on a better surface in normal weather.

The Z28 isn't a drag racer nor should you
expect it to be
but mind the clutch and the throttle and you'll get to sixty miles an hour in
4 seconds, and the quarter mile in 12.3 seconds at a 117.2
miles an hour. Where the Z28 specializes
is breaking and handling.

While our best stop took just 97 feet the Z28
stayed

under a hundred feet for the majority
of its breaking runs
illustrating the system's tolerance for high heat. Around the figure-8 the
Z28 ran a 23.6 second lap

matching what we've recorded from the
Ferrari 458. The time might have been faster too
had second gear been slightly longer as the Z28 would
just get to the limiter before the breaking zone.

As for outright lateral grip we recorded an
average lateral acceleration

We've been eager to drive this car
ever since hearing GM was actually making it.
So we were excited to meet Randy Pobst at beautiful Barber Motorsports Park
in Alabama
to finally drive it.
We're here at Barber Motor Sports Park and I can hardly head myself over the roar of this
Camaro Z28 but I love it! The sound is good.
I'm on cold tired do you notice?
There's a 5 mode stability control and I'm on 3 because these cold tires
they run so aggressive they're like a racing slick
and they need to be warmed up.
Best way to warm tires is braking.

Now I can start to feel the traction
control working on power.
Yeah my foot's on the floor
but the computer is deciding how much power to deliver.
And I tell you what that's really kind of
a comfort under these conditions.
Track's a little damp still.
In 3 it's really aggressive, to me, stability control and
traction control bit of a comfort but now it's starting to annoy me.
I've got too much comfort.
Up with a rise
we've got traction
I'm going up a mode in traction we're on 4 which is Sport 2.
Down into turn 1
into the break zone man I broke too early this thing really stops!
Really powerful breaks.
Very quick response.
The shock damping helps the Camaro over the many rises and jumps here at
Barber Motor Sports Park.
Good trail break with the nose in 4.
Power down through the fast gas.
We are generating G-force with the Camaro in all directions accelerating.
It's taking a long time for these tires to warm up
but they're starting to feel really
good now.
305 tires all around that helps to give that throttle
a lot of grip and really stick.

We are going very satisfying car to
drive fast.
I must say.
Yeah baby, ha ha ha!
I love it.

Randy you just ran a 136.1 here in
the Z28 around Barber and that's
a really fast time for this track.
The morning felt a little different walk me through the learning curve for this car. It gets better
yes I think it's gone abroad power band because you rev it up and it gets better
and better.
And in cold temps the tires will let go.
In warms temps the tires are amazing.
Yeah they are really on. Part of the speed of the Z28 is in

Troph AOR aggressive track tire. That
ridiculous grip.
Yeah and it's huge the front tire is a 305 just like the back.
I can't think of a Mustang that would be as fast
around barber here. This thing is far quicker in a straight line
than even the boss 302.
Absolutely, absolutely. It's got a hundred and something more cubic inches too.
Ha ha, well Randy see you later. We're really praising it I almost feel
like Chevy commercial. I think they'll be pissed off about the Mustang comments but
that's alright. Oh okay okay yeah but no it is very reminiscent of the Boss
from Laguna Seca. Yeah faster though.
Faster and really touchy in the braking department.
But the Boss puts the power down better.
Kim.....Kim?! Say hi!
Alright stand still for like 2 seconds.
Ugg it's really cold.

title: 2014 Chevrolet Camaro Z/28: The Trans-Am Racer Returns! - Ignition Ep. 105

comments.text:

comments.author: Zefanya Andre

comments.text: Only 505 hp out of 7 liters and this is acceptable in 2015 ?﻿
comments.author: Janusha

comments.text:
+Janusha  Once again, “It’s bullshit” is the only argument you can give me. 
You have no numbers, no facts, and no logic to back it up. I’m sorry, but 
you have a rather juvenile understanding of automotive engineering, typical 
of a kid who is just starting to get into cars. I used to be like that too: 
I thought the Honda F20C was the best engine ever because it made such high 
horsepower-per-liter. Then I realized that, despite having much lower HP/L, 
the LS engines were putting out way higher power-to-weight than the F20C 
due to the way they are able to pack a very large amount of displacement 
into a very compact engine. Once you start understanding that, you begin to 
see how HP/L doesn’t actually mean much and how displacement alone doesn’t 
determine the actual physical size of an engine.

The fact is that the LS7 puts out over 500hp and weighs around 500lbs 
FULLY-DRESSED (including all accessories). THAT’s power-to-weight. It is 
also literally physically smaller and lighter than even the 3.8L engine in 
the GT-R. You cannot refute that. It is simply fact. The whole HP/L thing 
has been widely discredited for quite a long time now (and not just by 
muscle fanboys). The only thing about an engine that will make a car go 
faster in the end is power and weight. 

You can deny provable facts all you want, but in the end it just makes you 
look like an ignorant kid.
comments.author: Patrick Jane

comments.text:
Here comes another person complaining about power...as they even stated in 
the video, this car is a track car. So handling and braking is a big role 
in the new Z/28. Yes you could grab a SRT hellcat or any other common 
mustang with more power. But will it handle as well as the Z/28 on a 
track?? No. Camaro's may not be the fastest muscle cars now a days (Which 
is why every Mustang or Challenger fan boy bitches about how crappy it is) 
but Chevy has embraced that. Simply drive a base SS and you'll be impressed 
with how fun and perfect it drives.
comments.author: Alex Silva

comments.text:
+Patrick Jane
Dude. Ive heard it all before. Its bullshit.

Its american, therefore best by default. And while Im sure that goes down 
well back home amongst your own knd, it falls a bit flat to the ground 
everywhere else.

http://www.ukipme.com/engineoftheyear/

Here. International engine of the year awards. I dont see a single american 
engine mentioned. Not this year, not last year and nor the year before. 
There are very good reasons this. And the main reason is they simply refuse 
to get modern.
comments.author: Janusha

comments.text:
+Janusha  So basically, I just gave you provable facts and irrefutable 
logic, and you just outright denied all of it because you don’t want to 
appreciate what you call an “old-tech” engine. That’s classic ricer shit 
right there. I’m not even an American car fanboy: I’m simply smart enough 
to know that power-to-weight is what makes a car go faster in the end. 
Horsepower-per-liter will not make a car go faster; Volumetric efficiency 
will not make a car go faster: only power and weight. 

I used to be one of those kids like you who always talked shit on American 
cars for not making good horsepower-per-liter until I actually learned a 
thing or two about what makes a car go faster. You’ll learn.
comments.author: Patrick Jane

comments.text:
+Patrick Jane
yeah yeah yeah hp pr liter means nothing because Murca doesnt do it well. 
Therefore it means nothing. 

Hahaha yeah. Ive heard that amazing piece of shit so many times. How Murcan 
7 liter engines are so small. And so much cleaner and runs so much better 
and there is just no end to how great old american technology is.

Yeah I know. There is no cam on top. So they can THEORETICALLY fit it lower 
to the center of gravity in the car. but thats not what you people are 
actually fucking doing. Murca never once made a god damn midengined 
sportscar where that is a factor. Its just a bunch of excuses all the way. 
If americans all used 3 rows of 4 cylinders, for whatever reason, then you 
would be right here arguing how THAT is the best. Because its all about 
swinging that flag and thats all there is to it.

When we look at the official mpg listings and emissions, then its CLEAR who 
comes out first. Its AMAZING how you think the actual international car 
industry should revert to ancient pushrod tech instead of the US car 
industry taking a step up to be competitive for the first time in decades.
comments.author: Janusha

comments.text:
+Janusha The thing is, HP/L really means nothing: as it gives no indication 
of the actual size or weight of the engine. For example, did you know that 
the 7.0L engine in this Camaro is actually physically smaller and lighter 
than the 3.8L engine in the GT-R?
That's the advantage of the cam-in-block design of the LS engines: despite 
their very large displacement, the LS engines are physically smaller and 
lighter than most DOHC engines with half their own displacement. That's why 
these engines have such high power-to-weight compared to most DOHC engines.
comments.author: Patrick Jane

comments.text:
+Janusha The Big Three don't make "cars for themselves". They implement the 
same strategy the Japanese, unlike Europe, have been doing for a billion 
years: making different development centers and thus different cars for 
different regions. And therefore you see how both mainstream Japanese and 
US manufacturers kick Peugeot, Renault, Citroen, Fiat and all the other 
mainstream EU brands in the nuts when it comes to sales in non-European 
developed places like Australia, NZ, Japan or Korea. Go to Japan and it's 
full of Japanese cars you haven't even heard of, that are available in 
Japan only, the same way Ford or GM vehicles are available in the US and 
Canada only (with some additional markets like the Middle East and Mexico). 
Europe is only king when it comes to supercars and premium cars like 
Mercedes or Audi, not mainstream brands. Because mainstream EU brands are 
shit, except for Volkswagen.

And what do you mean, a cheap labor country? The US has by and large one of 
the highest wages in the world, and that's a fact.

And of course Cadillac are luxury cars. It's funnier that cars like a 
C-class, A4 or 3-series are luxury cars. Because they don't even have 
fucking luxuries as standard. A Toyota Camry is just as luxurious as a 
standard BMW 3-series, which is fucking ridiculous.

+Red Dreams  I take it you have never read European news about Putin? (not 
that US or European news about Putin is actually wrong though).

comments.text:
+Ron Valencia
Haha you people. Claiming ownership of BMW and other Euro cars too now? 
Yeah thats real clever. And how funny to call Cadillac and.... Lincoln 
"luxury" cars.

Thing is...
 BMW, Mercedes, Audi, Toyota, Nissan, Honda and others too have opened car 
ASSENBLY in the US of Murca. But not production. The cars are still made 
over in their countries just assembled in the US. Because then it can be 
done by unskilled, untrained people at minimum wages. Because USA... Has 
become a cheap labour country. BMW pays their workers back in Germany 3 
times more than they pay their american people.

They also do this because USA puts a heavy import tax on foreign cars. And 
the US Gov. has decided an imported car is a "luxury" so they can luxury 
tax them too. This is done to push foreign cars up market and out of 
competition with domestic cars. Who are also protected with lower taxes and 
such. But... When the European and Japanese cars are assembled in the US, 
they are no longer counted as "imports", they avoid all those taxes, create 
american jobs and everyone is happy. But that doesnt make it American for 
christs sakes. 

Sure. My country dont make cars. Most countries dont make cars. But USA is 
the largest, most car loving country in the world. Isnt it time they 
stepped up and actually competed internationally instead of just make cars 
for themselves? They TRY but they just dont seem to get it.

THE UNDERSTANDING OF ENGINEERING. 

there is many ways to extract power from a combustion engine some use FI

when you talk about the SIZE OF AN ENGINE you are speaking of the weight,

the days of measuring a engines over all size based on its liter # is

comments.text:
You know what's sad about youtube and the uneducated kids & adults that are 
newbs to cars is, how some believe pushrod motors are stone age technology, 
BUT, FAIL BAD to realize Over Head Cam motors are even older than pushrod. 
The first OHC motor was produced by Benz in 1903 and the first pushrod 
motor was built and produced in 1941 by Cadillac. I'm shocked at how after 
working in the auto industry for 15 years that people on YouTube must be 
some of the worlds most mentally challenged automotive enthusiasts. If 
anyone's knows about all the different valve systems for engines, actually 
pushrod cam in block motors are the latest form of valve technology created 
since the 40's. ﻿

I love this car and could definately see myself having one even thou Im 
definately not into american cars. Problem is, as with pretty much all new 
exciting cars it just costs too much. Itll never be down to prices where a 
normal person could or would want to own it. If it was around 50k and then 
in a few years maybe its worth half that, even I could think about buying 
one. Right now thou it costs as much as a brand new BMW M4 and I really 
dont think the Z28 is even remotely as good a car. With the same tires the 
M4 will post the same laptimes as the Z28 but at the same time its not a 
trackbreed racecar with numberplates as the Z28 is. You can use the M4 
every day, all yearlong as a normal car with all the luxuries of any other 
BMW.﻿

comments.text:
The Z/28 put down a better lap time than the GT on the Ring pal. And looks 
are subjective. Personally, I think the C7 has an awkward looking front end 
and a beautiful ass, but that's just me. 

But back to Ford vs Chevy.
If you think the GT is a better car because of build and legacy, cool. But 
Chevys perform better. Fact. The Z06 is slower on *3* tracks. Give it the 
Z07 upgrade and it is faster. The ZR1 gets beat on *1* track, and it isn't 
even a real track. I'm just spitting facts here.

I am completely happy with my 2011 2ss; though this car is amazing I don't 
think it was made to be a daily driver. It's a track car/collectors item 
for those who can afford to blow $75,000 on a car they'll drive once a 
month at most. It is possibly the best pony car ever built. Ford has some 
catching up to do. ﻿
comments.author: 222Brony

comments.text:
Meh.. the diff between a 13 sec car and 10 sec car is only a few car 
lengths over a quarter mile.  That's fucking pathetic.  Should be many car 
lengths just to 60... but turns out fast isn't very fucking fast after all. 
 I doubt you'd even feel the difference in acceleration between a 10 sec 
car and 13 sec.  Suspensions are so fucking good now that driving a high 
perf. car is nauseatingly boring.  You feel absolutely NOTHING on breaking, 
accelerating, turning... the car remains perfectly flat and composed.  Some 
say as it should, but it makes for a horrifically miserable driving 
experience.  I want my fucking neck snapped, and football linebacker brain 
damage when I put the fucking pedal down... this shit is a yawner.  To get 
that experience, you need a 10,000 hp dragster that hits 300mph in 6 sec. 
 God fucking damit I hate how boring street cars are.﻿

comments.author: Dogboy1960

comments.text:
Also the fact that the Corvette and Camaro are built and designed by 
completely different teams and are both given free will to make their car 
into whatever it is they want (to an extent, I'm sure) is a big part of why 
the Z28 is faster than the Stingray. This may change when the Z06 is 
released.
comments.author: Anthony Boysen

comments.text:
+stinkbandit ....... Gee, sounds like you need to go look up the Trans Am 
racing series because WOW.....are you ever WRONG when you say that the car 
was never built to race on the road course. In 1968 and 69 Chevrolet 
DOMINATED the series with it's "take no prisoners" effort......the Z/28. A 
lot of folks probably would be surprised to learn that you could order a 
1rst generation Camaro with 4 wheel disc brakes in the late 60s. The 302 
was a an engine that put every trick and performance piece Chevy could come 
up with in the small package with just ONE MISSION.......meeting the 
displacement limit requirement of the trans am racing series  and still be 
capable of producing over 400HP a pretty herculean effort back in the day.
Looking back........this was arguably the "raciest" engine GM produced in 
the 1960s.   The whole reason this new Z/28 is built as it is and given the 
name "Z/28"...... as an acknowledgement to the older cars and their race 
history.
comments.author: Dogboy1960

comments.text:
GM has a long history of using the best parts they can source in a track 
ready Camaro. The closest they've ever come to "protecting" the Corvette is 
underrating the advertised power in a Camaro engine vs Corvette. Anyone who 
owned one or both of the cars always knew though. As far back as 1968 and 
69 Z/28s could be ordered with pieces directly lifted from corvette.....4 
wheel disc brakes are an example......then things like cross ram dual four 
barrel manifolds designed SPECIFICALLY for the Camaro's 302 race motor were 
something even Corvette didn't have designed with any of it's motors in 
mind. GM's Corvette owners have to find comfort in the idea that Corvette 
has some basic design features that assure it "TOP DOG" status over Camaro. 
Because all the pieces in the GM parts bin seem to be available to both 
cars.
comments.author: Dogboy1960
